subject: meta-google- ipmi-config: Add google-version support
commitMessage:
meta-google- ipmi-config: Add google-version support

Read GBMC_VERSION and configure the ipmi firmware revision with the
major/minor. The aux is used for the point and subpoint. This allow gBMC
to remove the internal patch that we used to support our versioning
format.

Requires the change in
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-host-ipmid/+/54147/

Tested:
With firmware_revision in dev_id.json
```
$ cat /usr/share/ipmi-providers/dev_id.json
$ ipmitool mc info
{
    "id": 0,
    "revision": 0,
    "addn_dev_support": 0,
    "firmware_revision": {
        "major": 35,
        "minor": 16
    },
    "manuf_id": 11129,
    "prod_id": 14426,
    "aux": 0
}

ipmitool mc info
Device ID                 : 0
Device Revision           : 0
Firmware Revision         : 35.10
IPMI Version              : 2.0
Manufacturer ID           : 11129
Manufacturer Name         : Google, Inc.
Product ID                : 14426 (0x385a)
Product Name              : Unknown (0x385A)
Device Available          : yes
Provides Device SDRs      : no
Additional Device Support :
Aux Firmware Rev Info     :
    0x00
    0x00
    0x00
    0x00
```

Change-Id: I64ed6f54612d45732e366a2b245d33db00540093
Signed-off-by: Willy Tu <wltu@google.com>

Created a revert of this change as I783ad8563ad16a1e6ed3e7f4d92323655e97afac
It looks like you have the tested footer in the other change - might want to copy it over here too
I guess you may want to mention that https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-host-ipmid/+/54147/ has to go in first.
Done
Done

I guess one question remains - what was the max of minor point again? (I remember some were like 256, some were 99, etc.) should we cover for 100s digit too in case it's just to 3 digits?

I'm wondering if it makes sense to enforce a min limit like you did for major
minor stylistic nit: prefer having the 10s digit before the 1s digit calculation (just swap the order).

I think major should be 127, but the ipmid code max it at 99.

and minor should be 256.

yeah, maybe we should.
Done
Where in the code did you find this? Might be good to link it in the comment for future reference (to understand the logic)
This is internal. But is from the spec that I can never find.
Ah I see :(

😞

No idea why this is failing for gsj. I am built the recipe locally with no issue. Building full image now.
no luck, but I think it is because `GBMC_VERSION` does not exists for gsj.
Oh. Is gsj not getting the gbmc distro?
I guess not.
Done

I see the workaround - could this perhaps affect other platforms bringing in the meta-google layer but are not gbmc? I'm not sure how overriding addtask works (and if this will run on other platforms)

Maybe all of this should be behind a MACHINE_FEATURE to prevent all of this from happening.

Or just check that `GBMC_VERSION` is valid instead.
Done
I guess this means gsj will not get a BMC version from this command? Might need to check internally if that's an issue
there is no active development on it, so it will probably be fine. + since they never used it. This will be a no-op for them.
Wouldn't it be a problem if we take out the internal patch though?
I don't think so. The internal version of gsj will have GBMC_VERSION.
Ah fair point.
Maybe this isn't the right place for this change because it can't actually test the python code in the openbmc CI?

oh, I thought it does. At least the build will fail it the function fail.

I guess it is not logically tested and we won't know the output.

No I mean, openbmc/openbmc can't actually set GBMC_VERSION the way our builds do, so none of the python is even executed let alone verified for correctness. I'm mostly worried about it cascading into build failures downstream when we rebase.
gbs does. Well, it uses the default version. So that tests it with 0.5.0.0.
ohhhh I forgot we set a default version in the distro... nvm.

Oh wait... I don't know why I submitted it... 

Still need https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-host-ipmid/+/54147/. I guess we can either revert for now or patch it downstream to replace the patch we had before to support Google version.
